thread.title: Blind Date is making a comeback with Vicky Pattison set to take over from Cilla Black
thread.title_full: Blind Date is making a comeback with Vicky Pattison set to take over from Cilla Black

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Blind Date is making a comeback with Vicky Pattison set to take over from Cilla Black
text:
Blind Date is making a comeback with Vicky Pattison set to take over from Cilla Black The classic TV dating show will be back on screens this year Share Get celebs   
Blind Date was hosted by Cilla Black for nearly two decades. 
And now the 1990s favourite is set to return to our screens by the end of 2017 – after 13 years away. 
TV host Vicky Pattison, 29, is hotly tipped to replace the late Cilla Black. Cilla Black presented Blind Date for nearly two decades (Photo: Rex) Vicky Pattison could be set to replace Cilla Black (Photo: FameFlynet) 
Also in the frame is singer Olly Murs, 32, as well as actresses Georgia May Foote, 25, and Helen Flanagan, 26. 
When it returns, Blind Date will be shown on Channel 5 – not ITV. 
“Blind Date is the original dating show and it’s huge news to bring it back,” a source told The Sun . Blind Date was a firm Saturday night favourite (Photo: ITV) 
“It’s a classic format that will be rebooted to make it young, sexy and modern. Expect sparks to fly. 
“In an age of Tinder, you have got to earn the right to love on this show.” 
The show will be produced by So Television – which makes The Graham Norton Show – and Stellify Media, a company part-owned by Sony Pictures Television. Cilla Black talking to Blind Date contestants 
The show is expected to appeal to “a new generation of viewers” while keeping some of the “traditions of the past”. 
There’s likely to be six or eight episodes in the first series – that will be shown on Friday nights. 
The show revolves around three singletons hidden from the view of a member of the opposite sex who chooses them based on their answers – rather than their appearance. Cilla Black quit Blind Date in 2003 
The couple then pick an envelope revealing the destination of their date. 
The show was cancelled in 2003 after Cilla quit the show. 
The new version will be up against ITV’s Take Me Out and Meet The Parents. Like us on Facebook
